landmark-no-duplicate-contentinfo:
To ensure a document has at most one contentinfo landmark, you should use the appropriate HTML5 semantic elements, such as
or role="contentinfo", and avoid using them multiple times in the same document. This will help screen readers and other assistive technologies to identify and navigate the content more efficiently. Example: Here's a sample webpage structure that ensures there's only one contentinfo landmark: ```html Sample Webpage

Website Title

  • Home
  • About
  • Contact

Article Title

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Nulla luctus bibendum nulla, ut tristique velit sollicitudin id.

© 2022 Company Name. All rights reserved.

``` In this example, the
element with role="contentinfo" is used only once, ensuring that there's only one contentinfo landmark in the document. This makes it easier for screen readers and other assistive technologies to identify and navigate to the footer information.
